title: A platform for e-Freight

I would start by just introducing our agenda.

I want to talk a little bit about the scope and objectives for the platform and the architectural approach because this paper is about the architecture of the platform, the stakeholder requirements, and they freight features that are derived from the stakeholder requirements.
The business architecture, the data architecture and then some conclusions.

In terms of our objectives, we want to create a platform that will provide the comprehensive software infrastructure to facilitate the development and deployment of freight solutions in compliance with the freight framework that again we discussed a lot in the last two days.
The center of what we are doing is the freight framework.
This is what it will be a standard that will enable us to create the interoperability.
That we all want and the platform is therefore just the tool that will enable the implementation and services to be produced efficiently.
And to be compliant with this framework.
And of course some of our key objectives is that this platform will promote their use.
Interoperability and also data security and quality.
I think all of you in the last two days have identified that both data security and quality are key concerns of the industry.
Nothing will work until there is a lot of trust that there is enough data security and data quality to enable us to make decisions and to enable us to use this information in an efficient way.
So this is where we start from.

And together with that we have said from the beginning that the project is driven by our business partners by people like DSV and Standard and the number of administrations, particularly the my time administration of Latvia, who has been a very important partner in terms of developing our.

Systems, and you saw that again yesterday.
The platform is part of an overall concept which starts with the freight framework.
The freight framework is used in the platform and it is used to create the freight services.
These are web services that are compliant with the framework.
Therefore, when the framework changes, we can change the services and from these services will compose solutions.
Applications that are being used by the different.
Business organizations and administration organizations.

And again you see here that we emphasize that we would support different implementation options so that of course stakeholders, operational environments, whatever they use, whether it is javaoritis.net based environments, they will be able to choose the components that they want.
To download and using their own specific systems.

Now again we have a very detailed paper so that you will see that our architectural approach is based on togaf which is an industry standard now in terms of architectural methodology and this effectively what it does is that it provides a very holistic approach in defining architecture, giving a business view an application viewer data view in the technology will.
This is how it looks.
And you can see that we start with the architectural vision and then we move in looking at the business architecture, the information, architecture, technology, architecture.
We're looking at the opportunities that we can use.
We're looking at how we would migrate.
To these architecture and of course we're looking at the change management, which is one of the most important issues that we need to tackle if we want to be successful.
So for the freight platform division starting from the first step of our methodology is first award alignment or FIU policy business and IT.
And I think that this has to be very clear.
If a project is primarily aimed.
To implement to support the implementation of review policy, the policies that you heard yesterday and therefore to do that.
What is important is to manage to maintain an alignment between the the policy who is the business, the business objectives and the which will support it.
Our second main vision objective is that we want to support efficient development and change management with respect to business objectives of specific transport networks.
Again, we have seen that business is changing and I think it is for a long time.
It has been said that the only constant in life is change, so we have to deal with change.
The business is changing.
The glatorian environment is changing.
We must make that.
A top priority how to deal with that change?
You saw that we have specifically created modules within our approach to single transport to single windows to deal with that change.
And again I think I will maintain that this is probably the most important aspect that this platform.
We will help the industry to fulfilled manage the change and of course for the policy and.
But everything we do to be successful, it has to be adopted by by industry.
It's not good creating fantastic solutions if they're not taken up by the state.

So in terms of these three vision objectives, we have produced the requirements, detailed requirements, stakeholder requirements, which are detailed in the paper.
Here we are looking at the alignment of EU policy business diety and you can see that we start from primarily the European policies, both in terms of creating data services that will support.

The the the Transparency and information that we need in monitoring at the cargo as it moves along, but also for looking at reducing environmental impact, creating efficient services, greater threat visibility.
All these are policies from which we can derive specific stakeholder requirements that the platform will need to support.

And the the same, we have created a specification of the requirements with regard to the development and change management and we have used the model driven approach primarily and the service oriented development approach to help us with dealing with this specific require.

And to support the adoption of the freight solution, our key objective is particularly to create app stores to facilitate the use of App Store so that people can take and download specific components and integrate them within their own solutions within their own systems.
And in terms of core application services.
Applications that will be developed within the freight projects.
We have these three processes that we are supporting which are the three top level processes of the freight framework.
The first one is common long long term planning.
The second is operational management.
These are very, very closely linked to the processes that are being developed in limp so you can see that we have even changed our terminology to be consistent with the way Lim.

Is approaching these two specific areas, so we're working very closer with Limning in bringing together an industry focus than industry perspective in the definition of these processes, and the third one is regulatory information management, which is developed very closely in collaboration with Latvia Becausw.
There we're looking at developing segredo covering all modes and producing something that will work in practice.

Existing processes and link them with what he wants and then use them in collaborating with other providers.

This is a key issue for us and we hope that will develop a solution for it, 'cause I don't think it exists today.
I don't think we even understand quite often what we mean by data quality, and I think this is probably where is.

The freight platform is intended to support the implementation of EU policy or freight.
Particularly by facilitating the development of freight solutions compatible with the standardized different framework.
And we would address 3 main processes.
Regulatory information management, long-term planning of resisting solutions and transport and logistics operational management.
The focus is on single window signal transport, document security management by authorities and deployement of intelligent transport systems.
